snippet: No injuries were reported, but the intensity and early arrival of the season’s first major wildfire in California offered a worrisome indicator of what may be a severe fire season.
abstract: Walls of wind-driven fire sweep across Ventura County, Calif, forcing thousands of home evacuations, shutting down schools and offices and ravaging acres of woodland; firefighters struggle for second day to bring the ominously early California wildfire under control.

byline.contributor: Matt Kettmann contributed reporting from Santa Barbara, Calif.

lead_paragraph: No injuries were reported, but the intensity and early arrival of the season’s first major wildfire in California offered a worrisome indicator of what may be a severe fire season.

headline.seo: California Wildfire Drives Thousands From Homes
headline.main: Early Wildfire Drives Thousands From Homes in Southern California
headline.print_headline: Early Wildfire Drives Thousands From Homes in Southern California
